examples.sentence: Don't believe his campaign promisesâ€”it's all political gab.
The meeting was just gab without any concrete decisions.
Her gab made her the perfect host for the talk show.
The taxi driver's endless gab about soccer annoyed me.
They gabbled for hours about conspiracy theories.
Don't gab nonsense when the teacher asks you a question.
We had a midnight gab session about K-dramas.
Live streamers need the gift of gab to sell goods.
The kindergarteners gabbled excitedly about the dinosaur exhibit.
Tourists gabbled in various languages at the Great Wall souvenir shop.
My aunt gabbled on about her mahjong winning streak for hours.
The live-streamer gabbled nonstop to sell hairy crabs.
He gabbled the safety instructions before the roller coaster started.
The auctioneer gabbled the bids at lightning speed.
There was nothing but gabble when all the interviewees spoke at once.
The announcement was just gabble over the noisy subway.
Ignore his gabble about 'internet quantum energy'.
The meeting was full of corporate gabble like 'synergy' and 'paradigm'.
The taxi driver gabbled away about Beijing's traffic changes.
She gabbled out her WeChat ID before the train doors closed.
The gabby tour guide turned a 5-minute history lesson into a 3-hour monologue.
My gabby aunt can describe her supermarket trip like an epic novel.
After three coffees, he became as gabby as a parrot.
The red-brick house had a steep gable covered with ivy.
Santa Claus got stuck in the chimney because the gable was too narrow.
The carpenter measured the angle of the gable carefully.
During the typhoon, a loose gable board sounded like ghost knocking.
Traditional Chinese architecture rarely uses gable roofs.
The gabled roofs of Amsterdam look like chocolate bar wrappers.
Our gabled cottage won first prize in the village cuteness contest.
This gabled birdhouse mimics the Great Hall of the People.
Traditional gabled wooden bridges are disappearing in Zhejiang.
The gadfly's bite made the cow kick violently.
Greek philosophers compared Socrates to a gadfly stinging the lazy horse of Athens.
That paparazzo is a real gadfly who keeps asking invasive questions.
My little brother became a gadfly during my online meeting.
The blogger acts as a political gadfly exposing corruption.
The new kitchen gadget can peel apples in 3 seconds.
His keychain has 10 different mini gadgets.
The spy used a gadget disguised as a lipstick.
Children love the bubble-blowing gadget in Happy Meal.
The magician's gadget was actually a hidden mirror.
The hacker used a gadget to bypass the firewall.
The latest tech gadget is a ring that measures UV exposure.
As a gadget freak, he owns 7 smartwatches.
The spy's coat was lined with high-tech gadgetry.
Apple Store showcases the latest iPhone gadgetry.
His desk is a museum of useless gadgetry.
Japanese capsule toys are delightful gadgetry.
Road signs in the Scottish Highlands are written in both English and Gaelic.
The word 'whisky' originates from Gaelic 'uisge beatha' meaning 'water of life'.
The Gaelic football final always draws huge crowds in Ireland.
She wore a traditional Gaelic cloak at the cultural festival.
Only 1.1% of Scotland's population can speak Scottish Gaelic fluently.

examples.sentence: The fisherman lifted the tuna with his gaff, its sharp hook glinting in the sunlight.
Traditional whaling gaffs are now displayed in museums as historical artifacts.
The sail tore when it caught on the gaff during the storm.
Adjusting the gaff angle changes the sail's profile for optimal speed.
The crew gaffed the thrashing marlin after a three-hour fight.
Illegally gaffing protected species can result in heavy fines.
The scammer gaffed tourists with fake terracotta warrior souvenirs.
He got gaffed into buying 'authentic' mooncakes made with recycled fillings.
Startup founders must stand the gaff during the initial cash-burning phase.
The CEO's gaffe of calling his rival 'my ex-wife' went viral.
Making a gaffe in ancient China could cost you your head.
His drunken gaffe at the wedding became legendary in their village.
The politician's gaffe of eating a banana with peel shocked the nation.
Calling your teacher 'mom' is a classic classroom gaffe.
His attempt to speak Sichuan dialect turned into a hilarious gaffe.
The ambassador committed a gaffe by mixing up Tibet and Taiwan.
Using chopsticks to stab food is considered a social gaffe.
The gaffer at the village pub always tells stories about the old days.
A gaffer in plaid shirt was fishing by the river with his grandchildren.
The kind gaffer helped the lost tourist find the train station.
In British films, you'll often see a gaffer drinking tea in a cozy cottage.
The construction gaffer yelled 'Tea break!' through his megaphone.
As the factory gaffer, he kept a jar of biscuits for hardworking workers.
The gaffer adjusted the spotlight to make the actor's face glow.
Spielberg's gaffer invented a new technique using LED strips for this scene.
The chief gaffer won an Oscar for creating moonlight effects with toilet paper rolls.
The spy movie showed a kidnapper using duct tape as a gag.
Magicians often use colorful gags in their performances.
His terrible joke was a complete gag to our meeting.
The CEO's sudden announcement put a gag on salary debates.
The new law could gag independent journalists.
Protesters accused the government of gagging the media.
The chili oil nearly gagged me with its intensity.
Thick smoke from the BBQ gagged all the diners.
The comedian kept gagging during the livestream.
Variety shows love hosts who can gag spontaneously.
The dentist told me to control my gag reflex.
The court issued a gag order on the celebrity divorce case.

examples.sentence: He left his gold watch as a gage for the loan.
In pawnshops, your Rolex becomes a gage until repayment.
The knight threw down his gauntlet as a gage of battle.
The hacker's attack was a gage to the company's cybersecurity.
She gaged her inheritance to start the hotpot chain.
Ancient merchants would gage their entire stock for voyages.
The gambler gaged his wedding ring on a mahjong game.
Never gage your salary on cryptocurrency trading!
The rain gage showed 50mm precipitation overnight.
Tire pressure gages are essential for safe driving.
Scientists gage CO2 levels with laser sensors.
The app can gage your heart rate through the camera.
Can you gage how many people are in this WeChat group?
The chef gaged the chili level for foreign customers.
The tech giant took up the gage of developing 6G.
The startup threw down the gage to the industry leader.

examples.sentence: The gagging process straightened the warped steel beam perfectly.
Ancient blacksmiths used primitive gagging techniques with fire and hammers.
Gagging without heating requires precise force calculation.
The shipyard uses hydraulic gagging for hull plates.
A gaggle of geese blocked the bicycle lane near Houhai.
The gaggle followed their leader into the pond like tiny cloud soldiers.
A gaggle of tourists took selfies with the Peking duck chef.
The meeting room was full of a gaggle of reporters.
The sudden gaggle startled the cat on the windowsill.
Morning gaggles from the nearby farm serve as my natural alarm clock.
The geese gaggled loudly when they saw the bread crumbs.
These ducks gaggle differently from their country cousins.
A gaggle of girls discussed BTS' new album excitedly.

examples.sentence: The gaiety of children playing with bubble guns filled the park.
Her gaiety was as contagious as TikTok dance challenges.
The gaiety of Spring Festival is reflected in red lanterns everywhere.
Panda's rolling gaiety makes it the national happiness ambassador.
The gaiety of winning the lottery lasted exactly until the tax bill arrived.
Her eyes sparkled with the gaiety of someone who just got 5G signal.
A burst of gaiety erupted when the teacher cancelled the exam.
His forced gaiety at the reunion was as convincing as a 3-yuan Rolex.

examples.sentence: The peacock spread its tail gaily in the sunset.
Tang Dynasty pottery was often gaily painted with floral patterns.
Children ran gaily through the cherry blossom rain.
The grandma sang gaily while making zongzi.
The Mid-Autumn Festival lanterns were gaily decorated with rabbit motifs.
Traditional Miao minority costumes are always gaily colored.
The new antenna design provides 30% signal gain.
Audio engineers adjust gain levels like chefs seasoning soup.
The museum's latest gain is a Ming dynasty teapot.
Knowledge gains from Douyin are like fast-food nutrition.
Bubble tea shops see 300% gains in summer months.
His crypto gains vanished faster than hotpot broth.
She gained 10 million followers by eating spicy crayfish.
IKEA gained market share with meatballs and DIY culture.
Huawei's 5G patents are gaining worldwide.
My weight gains faster than my salary during holidays.
Chinese EVs are gaining ground in European markets.
Fitness coaches always say 'no pain no gain' while you're sweating.

examples.sentence: The lucky gainer of the lottery built a duck-shaped villa.
As the gainer of three gold medals, he donated them to a museum.
The real gainers in this business deal are the lawyers.
Surprisingly, the small shops became gainers during the pandemic.
The underdog team turned out to be the ultimate gainer.
In e-sports competitions, the gainer usually gets a golden mouse.
After calculating taxes, we're still the net gainer.
Selling bubble tea near schools proved to be a gainful business.
His gainful smile suggested the stock market rally benefited him greatly.
The gainful merchant even tried to sell umbrellas during a solar eclipse.
Her gainful nature made her charge friends for WeChat red packet tutorials.
Delivering takeout is his first gainful employment after graduation.
She invested gainfully in tech start-ups before the AI boom.
The antique vase was gainfully resold at triple its purchase price.
After graduation, he worked gainfully as a livestream host selling farm products.
Many retirees remain gainfully employed as consultants in China.
The new policy encourages stay-at-home moms to become gainfully employed.
The gaining process creates precise grooves for circuit boards.
This CNC machine specializes in aluminum gaining with 0.01mm tolerance.
Traditional Japanese joinery uses manual gaining techniques.
The artisan demonstrated gaining with chisel and mallet.
This antique gaining tool is displayed in the Carpenter's Museum.
No one can gainsay the popularity of bubble tea in Asia.
Even the strictest teacher couldn't gainsay his perfect test scores.
She gainsaid every point in the debate like a TikTok arguer.
The CEO gainsaid the rumors about company bankruptcy with sales data.
His alibi was without gainsay during the police interrogation.
The celebrity issued a gainsay of the scandal on Weibo.
The success of Huawei is beyond gainsay in global markets.
No one dared give gainsay to the emperor's decision.
The panda's waddling gait attracts millions of viewers on Douyin.
Her catwalk gait could be recognized from 100 meters away.
The AI system analyzes elderly people's gait to predict fall risks.
His drunken gait made the security guard suspicious.
The coach gaited the racehorse with virtual reality technology.
She professionally gaited show dogs for competition.
The doctor noticed the patient's abnormal gait immediately.
Hikers wear gaiters to prevent snow from entering their boots.
The soldier's leather gaiters clicked rhythmically as he marched.
Fishermen pull on their yellow gaiters before wading into the river.
These waterproof gaiters are essential for rice farmers during planting season.
Cyclists in the 1900s wore knee gaiters to protect their trousers.
The Moon's gravity is about 162 gals compared to Earth's 980 gals.
This high-precision instrument can detect changes of 0.001 gal.
The Mid-Autumn gala features floating lanterns and mooncake buffets.
We're organizing a gala for stray cats adoption day.
The Nobel Prize gala has stricter dress code than Met Gala.
They held a gala to celebrate the successful launch of their new product.
The gala dinner served Peking duck carved by robot chefs.
The Spring Festival gala performance will include AI-generated crosstalk.
The galactic fluid in this alien movie glows like blue milk.
Ancient Greeks believed the Milky Way was formed by Hera's galactic spray.
Chinese astronomers discovered a galactic dance of twin black holes.
The galactic center tastes like raspberries, according to radio telescopes.
Douyin's galactic traffic crashed servers during Spring Festival.
His galactic ego couldn't fit through the office door.
Ancient Chinese poets called the galaxy "Yinhe" meaning Silver River.
The Milky Way galaxy contains our solar system.
The Andromeda Galaxy will collide with ours in 4 billion years.
Astronomers discovered a galaxy shaped like a giant panda.
The ceremony gathered a galaxy of tech billionaires.
CCTV's Spring Festival Gala always features a galaxy of stars.
Huawei's research center is a galaxy of tech talent.

examples.sentence: The gale blew away my new umbrella like a kite.
Fishermen hurried back to shore when the gale warning sounded.
The castle's gale was paid in silver coins every quarter.
Peasants protested against the increased gale during the barley harvest.
The typhoon reached gale force 10 near Zhoushan Islands.
All flights were canceled after the gale warning was issued.
Traditional Chinese medicine uses bear gall as an ingredient.
The bitterness of gall was compared to life's hardships in ancient poems.
Oak galls are used to make iron gall ink for calligraphy.
The round gall on the leaf looks like a tiny planet.
His constant complaints filled her with gall.
The gall! He ate my last dumpling without asking!
The neighbor's midnight piano practice galled the whole building.
It galls me when people slurp noodles loudly on the subway.
The new shoes galled my heels during the marathon.
The horse's saddle was galling its back.
Losing the final match was gall and wormwood to the team.
He had the gall to ask for a pay raise after being late 20 times.

examples.sentence: The Roman galleys clashed with Carthaginian ships in the Punic Wars.

The pirate captain stared at the royal galleys approaching with dread.
Naval museums often display scale models of historic galleys.

Wearing wet jeans is a galling experience during monsoons.
The galling noise of upstairs renovation starts precisely at 7am.
It's particularly galling when your WiFi dies during a video call with your boss.
The most galling moment was when my toddler corrected my English in public.
Getting outbid by 1 yuan in a housing auction is galling beyond words.
Gallium melts in your hand like magic chocolate.
Scientists use gallium to make flexible circuits.
The duke's son was spotted gallivanting with opera singers at midnight.
In Jane Austen's novels, wealthy men often gallivant between ballrooms.
Retirees gallivant around Europe with their pension money.

The horse broke into a gallop when it smelled fresh grass.

The delivery man finished his route at a gallop.
News spread at a gallop through Weibo.
Electric bikes gallop through Beijing's hutongs.
His thoughts galloped ahead of his speech.
The project is galloping toward completion.
Inflation has been galloping since the pandemic.
She galloped through her presentation in 5 minutes.
The anchor galloped the breaking news.
The jockey galloped his horse around the track.
Don't gallop the scooter in pedestrian areas!
SF Express galloped the vaccine to remote areas.
Drones gallop blood samples between hospitals.

examples.sentence: British gentlemen still wear galoshes over leather shoes in rainy seasons.

The CEO's resignation had a galvanic effect on the stock price.
Lie detectors measure galvanic skin response changes.
Scientists galvanized the frog legs to observe neuromuscular reactions.
The antique doorbell still galvanizes visitors with mild shocks.
Galvanized nails won't rust even in humid climates.
The rooftop water tank is galvanized for corrosion protection.

His resignation speech galvanized the whole company.
The climate report galvanized governments into action.

examples.sentence: The galvanized steel bucket survived 10 years in grandma's courtyard.
Your bicycle chain needs to be galvanized against rust.

The drowning puppy video galvanized netizens into rescue missions.
The Gambian president attended the China-Africa Summit.
This Gambian peanut stew recipe will blow your mind!
Gambians are known for their vibrant traditional wrestling.
The Gambians I met all had incredible rhythm when dancing.
He sacrificed a pawn in the opening gambit, just like sacrificing cilantro to win a hotpot debate.
The Queen's Gambit became famous after the Netflix series about chess prodigies.
Her dating app gambit was sending a meme about shared love for stinky tofu.
The CEO's gambit at the conference was joking about his failed livestream selling goods.
Bringing up zodiac signs is a classic gambit at awkward family dinners.

The opening gambit of her vlog was pretending to drop her phone into hotpot.
The mahjong parlour was raided for illegal gambling.
Online gambling addiction is spreading among delivery drivers.
Launching a milk tea shop during pandemic was a huge gamble.
Investing in cryptocurrency is like a high-stakes gamble.
He gambled away three months' salary in Macau casinos.
Addicts often gamble until their Alipay balance hits zero.
She gambled her tuition fee on the stock market.

The gambler lost three Ferraris in Macau last night.
Every gambler has a 'system' that never works.

The casino's neon lights twinkled like a gambler's last dollar.

Police raided the mahjong gambling den disguised as a tea house.
He sold his PS5 to pay off gambling debts.
The lambs' gambols in the meadow looked like fluffy clouds bouncing.
Her morning exercises include playful gambols across the yoga mat.
The children's gambols after exam week were pure joy to watch.
Panda cubs' gambols at the breeding base attract thousands of live-stream viewers.
Newly-shaved sheep gamboled awkwardly like cotton balls with legs.
The influencer gamboled across the rainbow runway for her TikTok video.
Couples were gamboling along the sunset beach with champagne sprays.
Retirees gambol in square dancing like giant human kaleidoscopes.
Kindergarten kids gambol about like wind-up toys after naptime.
The esports game attracted 200 million viewers worldwide.
Let's have a game of mahjong after hotpot!
Panda cubs roll in the snow just for game.

The game stood at 3-2 when the typhoon hit.
Douyin's recommendation algorithm changed the content game completely.
The restaurant was fined for serving protected game species.
He gamed away his entire year's salary in Macau.
That delivery rider was game to cross the flooded street.
The game leg didn't stop him from hiking Huangshan.
Game theory explains why Didi and Uber finally merged.
When the police scanned the QR code, the scammer knew the game was up.
The gamekeeper set up infrared cameras to catch poachers at night.

The old mahjong player gamely continued despite losing 10 rounds.

His psychological gamesmanship made the rookie miss three free throws.

TikTok dances highlight the generation gap between parents and teens.
Online education bridges the gap between urban and rural students.

examples.sentence: Shanghai's garbage sorting policy makes residents classify trash into 4 colors.
The smell of uncollected garbage in summer is worse than durian.
My drawer is full of garbage like broken phone chargers.
Those celebrity gossip magazines are pure garbage.
The melody of Taiwan's garbage trucks sounds like ice cream vans.
Peking University's intelligent garbage cans scan QR codes.
